subject: Re: [patchmanagement] KB5020276—Netjoin: Domain join hardening changes
email_text_original:
You don't often get email from bgonza868@gmail.com. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Which reminds me: Never use an account that is a member of Domain Admins or
the domain Admin account on a device you don't plan to use personally. Because
cached credentials are a thing and can still be used for interesting things. Of
course, you could always clean up after yourself, but why take that risk? 
You don't have to be a domain admin to join a client to the domain, you just
need the ability to domain join, the prospective computer account not to be
otherwise blocked, and local admin on the machine. (Not in that order, but all 3
required for a completely successful join) 
Bryan Gonzalez
Senior Software Engineer
battleface.com
